news.title: How iRobot lost its way home
news.summary: iRobot survived three decades of competition, but couldn't survive European regulators killing its Amazon buyout. Now it's being taken over by its own supplier in bankruptcy court.

news.title: WhatsApp’s biggest market is becoming its toughest test
news.summary: Meta has three months to comply with Indian government directions that could affect how WhatsApp operates in the country.

news.title: Grok got crucial facts wrong about Bondi Beach shooting
news.summary: Grok, the chatbot built by Elon Musk’s xAI and popularized on his social media platform X, appears to have repeatedly spread misinformation about today’s mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Australia.

news.title: Mesa shuts down credit card that rewarded cardholders for paying their mortgages
news.summary: Fintech startup Mesa has shut down its Homeowners Card, which awarded points to cardholders for paying their mortgages.

news.title: Making sense of the risky Netflix-Warner Bros. deal
news.summary: Netflix's $82.6 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. encapsulates a fraught moment for Hollywood, as the entertainment business is increasingly overshadowed by tech giants.

news.title: Kindle app now answers questions about the book you’re reading
news.summary: Amazon has launched a new AI feature in the Kindle app that gives spoiler-free answers to questions about the book you're reading, and confirmed that authors can't opt out from the feature. news.title: Feeding the machine
news.summary: When he was 19 years old, Brendan Foody started Mercor with two of his high school friends as a way for his other friends, who also had startups, to hire software engineers overseas. news.title: Starlink and Chinese satellites nearly collided last week
news.summary: A collision in space was narrowly avoided last week when a newly deployed Chinese satellite came within a few hundred meters of one of the roughly 9,000 Starlink satellites currently operating in low Earth orbit. news.title: Who is Picea Robotics, Roomba’s new owner?
news.summary: iRobot, the owner of the Roomba robot vacuum, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, stating that it will be acquired by its contract manufacturer, Picea Robotics. news.title: iRobot files for bankruptcy
news.summary: After 35 years, the maker of the Roomba robot vacuum filed for bankruptcy protection late Sunday night.
